alert.note: Alert for Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 9:54PM CDT until May 23 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. .Water levels are dropping reaching Action stage early next week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Halstad. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 27.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Thursday was 27.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday morning and continue falling to 23.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
